title: Pool Party Ahri
body:
Hey everyone!
===================
I love Ahri, and I feel as Pool Party Ahri could be a skin that would be a great skin for her! Here are my ideas of how I imagine it looking like!

===================

Q: Ahri will through out a **water** sphere! Or a **beachball**! 

W: Ahri will summon 3 **water** orbs around her to seek out for enemies!

E: (MOST EXCITED ABOUT! :) Ahri will through out a **squid**, if a enemy unit contacts with the squid, the squid will turn towards Ahri, and the squid tentacles will be wrapped around the enemy, bringing them closer to Ahri! (Something like [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eYthI8sVTME)! Just without the screaming! XD)

R: Ahri will dash to a location causing **water effects** to go around her during this time!

===================
Hopefully you want this skin as much as I do! If so, give it a upvote and click the vote that says, "YES PLEASE!"
Thanks for stopping by! :)

replies.body:
This is a really awesome take on the idea of Pool Party Ahri; it's done in a really tasteful manner, but also keeps her personality. 

I love the design of her bathing suit, and the tails are super cute. I like the idea of her having sandy particles, as opposed to pool noodles for tails, which is another idea that's been suggested. 

Ahri is a champion where gameplay clarity is a priority which means several of her particle can't be changed super drastically - mostly when it comes to color. (Popstar Ahri and Challenger Ahri are good examples of how we can change the particles to make them work with the skin). 

I love the idea of her tossing out a beach ball (Q) - it could easily be blue/green depending on if she has her passive up. 

The water orbs for her (W) would be a nice touch (we'd just have to be careful it's not super similar to Syndra - particularly Atlantean). Maybe we could make them more splashy? 

The (E) is something that's super iconic, so we may need to be a bit more careful here. We could take the charm particle and make a subtle squid in it, rather than tossing out a full on squid. That said, it'd have to remain some shade of pink. 

The water effects for (R) could definitely work! 

What are your thoughts? :D
Maybe instead of water orbs they could be water balloons? So as not to confuse with Atlantean Syndra at all. Plus, waterballoons!

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=OkskRE9j,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-12T09:11:07.759+0000)
>
> Riven barely wears any armor in her classic skin anyway.

It's not about the classic skin not having a lot of clothing, it's about the character themselves. Do you think the Poster-Child of Noxus, who left them because she almost died because of Noxus bombing her, would turn around, put on a Bunny Girl outfit, and swing a giant carrot-shaped blade?

Let me tell you a little something about Bunny Girls: Their outfits don't offer much in the way of mobility. In fact, you need training. [Taken from an article interview of a former Bunny Girl:](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/features/8470245/My-life-as-a-Playboy-Bunny-girl.html) 
> Most of us hadn’t worked as waitresses before – and Playboy seemed to prefer it that way. Bunny Training, presided over by the suave Keith Hefner, was a sort of Bunny boot camp in which we learned signature moves, such as the Bunny Stance, Bunny Dip, High Carry, Bunny Crouch and Bunny Perch. **The Dip was a graceful backward arch with knees together, employed while serving drinks to keep the girl’s over-stuffed, over-extended breasts from popping out of the costume.** The “High Carry” was designed to manoeuvre a tray full of drinks high over the head through a crowded room.

Do you think an outfit that requires training to not pop out your breasts would be worn by someone fighting [with a Sword bigger than she is?](http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Riven_0.jpg) on a battlefield with monsters like Cho'gath running around? Why would she wear something that requires training just to not expose herself, _much less something that doesn't offer any actual protection?_ 

And then we'll get into her actual personality: She could only be argued to have worn this once in canon, and that was to approach someone in a disguise to kill them with their guard down. The splash art reflects it perfectly, with Riven in a position for a leaping vertical slash down (which would cause quite a lot of damage to anyone. Forget if they are wearing armor, that Sword'd at least break any helmet with that kind of slash if not cut clean through what's under it.) and though she's looking at the screen,  I would point you to the man next to her. [Now who does that look like, I wonder?](http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Swain_3.jpg) Notice how he's positioned: I'd say he was backing away frantically, wouldn't you? He even knocked aside a table (though I question why he was sitting in a spot like that, that he'd back into a table?)

Other than that, she has served in at least the Noxian-Ionian War, and every skin she has aside from her Battle Bunny has some kind of armor incorporated into it (Crimson Talon is like a headdress and Classic is very weird but let's not get into that.) Now, why would she suddenly stop wearing armor? It's a disguise, and that's it (though considering her status as a Champion I'm amazed it even worked the first time.) It's not meant to be something you'd wear into a battle like the Fields of Justice. It's Fan Service, on a Champion that has no reason for it. I admit, I hate Riven, I hate her Lore, I hate her Kit, I hate everything about her, but even as there's no one I want to see removed from the game more, I still absolutely hate that skin more than anything in this entire game because it's Pure Fan Service and a Disservice to the character.
